page.title: 04Finedon A Walk.
page.content: I walked past some streets named after the old squires of Finedon such as Mulso Road,Mackworth Green,Dolben Square.I went past the Bell Inn which is believed to be the oldest licensed pub in England.A license was granted in 1042.It was largely rebuilt of ironstone in 1872 and features the arms of the Mackworth and Dolben families.There is also a statue of Queen Edith who once owned Finedon.Just beyond the inn is Thingdon cottage, Thingdon comes from Tingdene which was the original name of Finedon. We passed the former girls charity school and the parish church.To the north of the church is the old Boys School founded in 1595 and bearing the coat of arms of Elizabeth I.It is now a private house.
